footer: Aerial view of the construction of Port Vell. TAVISA / Jordi Todó (AFB)
Construction of the Marina Port Vell sport and leisure port, with more than 400 moorings, 1992. E. Maynés (AFB)
The Special Plan for Port Vell was approved by the Barcelona Urban Planning Commission on 11 May 1989. Author unknown (AFB)
Up until that time, Port Vell had been a free trade zone and was therefore an area members of the public were barred from, 1987. Author unknown (AFB)
The Moll de la Fusta was the first area given over to the port. Designed by Solà-Morales, it was opened in 1987. CB Foto (AFB)

footer: The refurbishment of the Barceloneta Quay entailed the demolition of the old rafals in order to create a promenade, the Passeig Joan de Borbó, 1990. Fris (AFB)
The Port Vell redevelopment project aimed to give prevalence to leisure, commercial and tourist uses of the area, 1991. Author unknown (AFB)
